p: VBDs of major public health importance include a wide variety of bacterial, parasitic, and viral infections that are spread by blood-feeding arthropods. In North America, prominent examples of VBDs include West Nile virus (WNV), Lyme disease, and dengue virus ( Table 1). In the United States, the most common tick-borne infection is Lyme disease, which results in extensive health care costs and productivity losses. In 2008 alone, there were 35,198 cases of Lyme disease reported in the US.
